description: First prime of A031938 (lesser of primes differing by 20) so that its distance to the next 20-twin increases.
comments: 1. the smallest distance between 20-twins is 24 [= A052380(10)], while its minimal increment is 6.2. a(n)=p starts [p,p+20,p+6n+18,p+6n+38] and [20,6n-2,20] patterns of primes and their difference.
formula: a(n)=p is the smallest prime which starts a [p, p+20] twin followed by the next [p+6n+18, p+6n+18+20] twin.
author: _Labos Elemer_, Mar 07 2000
